byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Tehran is reportedly working on bridging gap between Western demands for inspections of any nuclear-related facility and declaration by Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei that foreigners are not permitted to enter military sites or interview Iranian scientists.
lead_paragraph: An Iranian official signaled a willingness to accept Western demands for inspections of any nuclear-related facility, despite a previous rejection of such actions by the supreme leader.

headline.main: Signs of a Compromise Over Inspections in Iran Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Signs of a Compromise on Inspections Emerge in Iran Talks

snippet: An Iranian official signaled a willingness to accept Western demands for inspections of any nuclear-related facility, despite a previous rejection of such actions by the supreme leader.
